results.title: Susso kids
results.brief_description: Crops might just as well be ploughed into the ground or left to rot in the sun! From Black Thursday, October 1929, Australian productivity had never been higher, but there was no market for it. This documentary depicts causes and effects of the Great Depression in Australia, using film clips of the period. Shows the divisive effect of the disparity in living conditions, attempts by the unemployed to improve their social and economic circumstances and the plight of the children. Linked by songs of the period. Commentary by Telford Jackson.

results.title: Suspiria [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Dario Argento, Claudio Argento and La Seda
results.brief_description: Presented in widescreen, this un-cut version of Dario Argento’s ‘Suspiria’ is the first part (1980’s ‘Inferno’ being the follow up) in an as yet to be complete trilogy called “The Three mothers”. Susy Banyon (Jessica Harper), an American Ballet student travels to Germany to attend the exclusive Tanz Academy in Frieburg. Legend goes that the ancient school was once the residence of a witches coven, headed by an evil and powerful black witch named Mater Suspiriorum (Black Widow). When a series of grisly murders begin to occur at the ballet school, Susy begins to suspect that witchcraft may be involved. Working at the height of his creative powers (following the box office success of 1975’s ‘Deep Red’) Argento raises the level of terror with his trademark blood soaked set pieces by using vibrant colour film stock, abrupt editing, multi-layered sound scapes (including the techno-rock Goblin score) and rapid camera movement. Cast also includes Alida Valli, Udo Kier, Stefania Casini, Joan Bennett, Flavio Bucci, Miguel Bose, Barbara Magnolfi and Susanna Javicoli.

results.title: Suspiria (2018)
results.headline_credit: Italy and United States of America, 2018
results.brief_description: A darkness swirls at the center of a world-renowned dance company, one that will engulf the troupe’s artistic director, an ambitious young dancer and a grieving psychotherapist. Some will succumb to the nightmare, others will finally wake up.

results.title: Suspiria
results.brief_description: From the moment she arrives in Germany to attend the prestigious Tanz Academy, American ballet-dancer Suzy Bannion (Jessica Harper) senses that something horribly evil lurks within the walls of the age-old institution.

constellations_other.name: Over the Technicolor rainbow
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores the beginning and legacy of Technicolor and was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Adam Virgona and Kristian Vass.

constellations_other.name: The Suspense Constellation
constellations_other.description: An exploration of music in suspense works.

results.title: Suspicion
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: A dowdy and repressed young woman, a colonel’s daughter who has led a sheltered life, is irresistibly attracted to a man who is romantic and reckless, a rejection of everything her family background and upbringing have stood for. After their marriage she finds that he is a liar and, she suspects, a murderer. She comes to believe that he plans to murder her. Although the ending is apparently not what Hitchcock originally intended, the film as it now stands does not run counter to his interest in the themes of paranoia and the fragility of relationships. Cast includes Cary Grant, Joan Fontaine, Sir Cedric Hardwicke, Nigel Bruce and Dame May Whitty. Adapted from the novel ‘Before the Fact’ by Francis Iles.

results.title: Suspense
results.brief_description: Suspense is a 1913 American silent short film thriller directed by Lois Weber and Phillips Smalley. Weber also wrote the scenario and stars in the film with Valentine Paul. The film features early examples of a split screen shot and a car chase.

constellations_other.name: Lois Weber and the split-screen
constellations_other.description: Lois Weber was the third filmmaker to use split screens to show simultaneous action, helping establish it as part of cinematic language, particularly its use in thrillers. It's since been taken to extremes by auteurs and videogames.

results.description: An isolated house is too remote for a lone servant, who leaves a note, quietly exits the back door, and puts the key under the mat. Left alone in the house is a mother and her infant. A tramp has watched the servant leave and begins to skulk. When the lady of the house sees him outside as he discovers the key, she’s terrified and desperately phones her husband, who’s at work in town. He jumps into a car that’s idling in front of his office and races toward home, the car’s owner, and police, in hot pursuit.

results.title: Suspects all
results.creator_credit: Anthony Pelissier, Ronald H. Riley, Film Producers Guild and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: A dramatised fatal factory fire and its investigation shows how such accidents can result from carelessness, fire hazards such as litter, poor building design, overloaded electrical circuits and lack of fire drill for the staff.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anthony Pelissier, Ronald H. Riley, Film Producers Guild and R.H.R. Productions

results.title: Susan
results.creator_credit: Jason Ollivier, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Why can’t they be like we were?”.
Susan is the fifteen-year-old daughter of migrant parents and withwhom she is in conflict. She is trying to gain self-knowledge, and to sort out the problems she has with her parents, peer group and boyfriend.

results.title: Survivors of the Holocaust
results.creator_credit: Allan Holzman, James Moll, June Beallor and Turner Original Productions
results.brief_description: Chronicles the events of the Shoah (Holocaust) as witnessed by those who survived. This documentary combines archival footage with the survivor’s personal testamonies and photographs, describing life in pre-war Europe, the devastating impact of Nazism, the liberation of the concentration camps and life fifty years later. The impact of the survivor’s stories prompted Steven Spielberg to establish Survivors of the Shoah Visual History Foundation, a non-profit project to videotape tens of thousands of these personal accounts and make them available for education worldwide.
